Documentary Screening and Public Conference, 6 March 2015, King\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds College London</a></description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T16:34:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Demir,IA (pgt)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;5470c447.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;594bbc99.1503">   <title>Birmigham Fellowship in Superdiversity - Vacancy at University of Birmingham </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;594bbc99.1503</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>Apologies for cross-posting. You may find this job opportunity of interest<br><br>IRiS is inviting applications to the newly launched Birmingham Fellowship programme from individuals interested in undertaking conceptual work around the notion of superdiversity, developing new theory around societal adaptation to superdiversification and new approaches to modelling and visualising population diversity. The posts are permanent (at Lecturer or Senior Lecturer level), research focused and include a generous support package. For more information see: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T16:33:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nando Sigona (School of Social Policy)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;594bbc99.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;6fe925be.1503">   <title>Fwd: email for the list </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;6fe925be.1503</link>   <description> Professor (Migration and Refugee Studies)<br>Stellen - M\ufffd\ufffdrz 2015<br>Vacancy at Aalborg University, Copenhagen. Closing date: 10 April 2015<br>Follow the link below<br>http://www.konfliktbearbeitung.net/stellen/professor-migration-<br>and-refugee-studies<br><br>--<br>Dr Lucy Mayblin<br>Research Fellow<br><br>The Department of Politics<br>Elmfield<br>Northumberland Road<br>Sheffield, S10 2TU<br><br>Email: l.mayblin@sheffield.ac.uk   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T15:08:29+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Lucy Mayblin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;6fe925be.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;b4fa8fc7.1502">   <title>Rethinking integration: New perspectives on adaptation and settlement in an era of superdiversity, 2 July </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;b4fa8fc7.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>I thought this may be of interest and apologies for any crossposting<br><br>The Institute for Research into Superdiversity (IRiS) at the University of Birmingham, together with the project Social Anchoring in Superdiverse Transnational Social Spaces (SAST) is organising a one-day interdisciplinary conference which will focus upon theories on and research into adaptation and integration in an era of superdiversity. The conference will allow for the exchange of ideas and formulation of future research agendas to inform academics, practitioners and policy makers which can enable the facilitation of processes of adaptation and integration. The conference will feature invited plenaries [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-26T10:28:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nando Sigona (School of Social Policy)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;b4fa8fc7.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;fd447e1f.1502">   <title>FW: Recent diasporic studies from India </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;fd447e1f.1502</link>   <description> The list of books below may be of interest to list members.<br><br>Karim<br><br>Dear Madam/Sir,<br><br>Please find herewith few new publications on . Awaiting your orders.<br><br>1. Desai, Anita, 1937- Bye-bye blackbird / Anita Desai. -- Delhi<br>: Orient Paperbacks, 2012. 224 p. ; 20 cm. Novel. Reprint of:<br>New ed. 2006. ISBN 9788122200294 (pbk.) USD 10.60 (pbk.) 1.<br>Indic fiction (English) 2. East Indians--England--Fiction.<br>OCoLC#30967666 DK-191000<br>2. Indian diaspora in the Caribbean / [editor], Kumar Mahabir. -- New<br>Delhi, India : Serials Publications, 2011. xiii, 234 p. ; 22 cm.<br>Contributed articles. Reprint. Originally published: 2009.<br>Includes bibliographical references. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-11T10:07:39+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Karim.Murji</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;fd447e1f.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;29aaf882.1502">   <title>Booking Extended: BSA Citizenship Study Group Launch Event: Citizenship in the European Union </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;29aaf882.1502</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>We're pleased to announce that the BSA has re-opened the booking for our launch event of the BSA Citizenship Study Group: Citizenship in the European Union. The event will be hosted on Monday the 16th of February at the BSA Meeting Room in London. Early bookings are recommended, however, as there will be a limited amount of places available. The direct link to the booking is: http://portal.britsoc.co.uk/public/event/eventBooking.aspx?id=EVT10408 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-10T11:10:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kristoffer Halvorsrud</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;29aaf882.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;a40a9bd7.1502">   <title>Fwd: RESEARCHERS CROSSING BOARDERS: TRANSNATIONAL SCIENTIFIC MOBILITY SYMPOSIUM </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;a40a9bd7.1502</link>   <description> Estimados colegas,<br><br>Se ruega difundir. Muchas gracias<br><br>Saludos cordiales<br><br>*RESEARCHERS CROSSING BOARDERS: TRANSNATIONAL SCIENTIFIC MOBILITY SYMPOSIUM*<br><br>*Dear members of the scientific committee, *<br>*please find bellow the call for paper for the RESEARCHERS CROSSING<br>BORDERS: TRANSNATIONAL SCIENTIFIC MOBILITY SYMPOSIUM. 10th and 11th of<br>September 2015, Lisbon \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Portugal*<br>*Please forward to possibly interested groups / individual*<br><br>*Caros/as membros do comit\ufffd\ufffd cient\ufffd\ufffdfico,*<br>*segue abaixo a chama de trabalhos para o Simp\ufffd\ufffdsio RESEARCHERS CROSSING<br>BORDERS: TRANSNATIONAL SCIENTIFIC MOBILITY que acontecer\ufffd\ufffd nos dias 10 e 11<br>de Setembro de 2015, em Lisboa - Portugal*<br>*Por favor circular entre grupos de interesse.*   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T19:56:25-03:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Susana Sassone</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;a40a9bd7.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;ce416295.1502">   <title>Applications invited for a funded PhD on Cultural Diversity in the Arts </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;ce416295.1502</link>   <description> Please circulate to any people or networks who may be interested. Apologies for cross-posting.<br><br>ESRC Collaborative Doctoral Award on Cultural Diversity in the Arts<br><br>The Economic and Social Research Council Doctoral Training Centre at the University of Warwick<http://www2.warwick.ac.uk/fac/cross_fac/esrcdtc/>, one of 21 such centres in the UK, embodies the university's commitment to producing the next generation of leaders in social science research. Internationally renowned for its research excellence, Warwick is now inviting applications for an ESRC Doctoral Studentship in association with our collaborative partner The Drum Arts Centre<http://www.the-drum.org.uk/>, Birmingham, to commence in October 2015. As part of this collaborative project, the [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T17:43:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jones, Hannah</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;ce416295.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;1bc70787.1502">   <title>Booking closing today: BSA Citizenship Study Group Launch Event: Citizenship in the European Union </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;1bc70787.1502</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>We've just been told by the BSA that the booking for the launch event of the BSA Citizenship Study Group ('Citizenship in the European Union') will close today. Therefore, If you would like to attend the event, please book your place on the following link: http://portal.britsoc.co.uk/public/event/eventBooking.aspx?id=EVT10408 Apologies for the short notice. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T09:36:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kristoffer Halvorsrud</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;1bc70787.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;4e8c5d98.1502">   <title>CfP Glasgow Human Rights Network </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;4e8c5d98.1502</link>   <description> FYI, apologies for cross-posting.<br><br>Graduate Conference on Human Rights:<br>Challenges to Human Rights Theory and Practice<br><br>Call for Papers<br><br>The postgraduate cluster of the Glasgow Human Rights Network (GHRN), based at the University<br>of Glasgow, will be holding its second Graduate Conference on Human Rights on<br>Thursday 21st May 2015.<br><br>The keynote address will be given by Prof. Benjamin Gregg (University of Texas at Austin) on his forthcoming book, The Human Rights State. It will be public and held on the evening of Wednesday 20th May 2015. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T18:03:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sophie Badenhoop</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;4e8c5d98.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;3a89efb5.1502">   <title>Fwd: BSA Citizenship Study Group Launch Event: Citizenship in the EU </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;3a89efb5.1502</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;3a89efb5.1502">Fwd: BSA Citizenship Study Group Launch Event: Citizenship in the EU </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-02-04T09:30:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Demir, Ipek (Dr.)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;3a89efb5.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;b324c71c.1501">   <title>PhD scholarships at the University of Leicester, UK </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;b324c71c.1501</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>There are two types of scholarships (one has associated teaching duties) advertised at the Department of Sociology, University of Leicester. Preference will be given to applicants with a research proposal in any of the following areas:<br><br>* Citizenship<br>* Migration<br>* Sport<br>* Historical Sociology<br><br>http://www2.le.ac.uk/departments/sociology/news/phd-studentships-available-for-sociology<br><br>Please circulate widely.<br><br>Ipek    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-27T17:33:37+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Demir, Ipek (Dr.)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;b324c71c.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;56738cdd.1501">   <title>Detention Forum Event 20 Feb: What is immigration enforcement doing to us? Media, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdGo Home\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd vans and our lives</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;56738cdd.1501</link>   <description> The Detention Forum Salon<br><br>What is immigration enforcement doing to us? Media, ‘Go Home’ vans and our lives<br><br>Friday 20 February 2015 6:00pm to 8:30pm London<br><br>A discourse of ‘hardworking’ migrants is often used to counter anti-immigration opinions. On the other hand, what is rarely discussed is the impact of a range of immigration enforcement measures on migrant communities and British citizens. This salon-style event brings together academics, activists, a journalist, a NGO worker and individuals affected by immigration enforcement to explore what it means to be living in immigration-obsessed Britain during this pre-election period. Please come and join in [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-26T22:27:13+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jones, Hannah</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;56738cdd.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;dc765713.1501">   <title>Call for papers - \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMigration on the Margins: Exploring constructions of the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdillegitimate migrant\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;dc765713.1501</link>   <description> The Migration Studies Society at the University of Oxford, would like to announce the call for papers for the Annual Migration Studies Conference, to be held on the 15th and 16th of May 2015 at the University of Oxford.<br><br>The theme for this year’s conference is ‘Migration on the Margins: Exploring constructions of the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdillegitimate migrant\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd’. This conference is interested in exploring the effects of labels and notions of illegitimacy as it pertains to migration debates and lived experiences. By focusing on illegitimacy, the conference explores the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdmargins\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd of migration to reveal assumptions underpinning processes of establishing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdwho counts\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-24T15:00:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Demir, Ipek (Dr.)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;dc765713.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;8175ec78.1501">   <title>Reminder / CFP - BSA Early Career Theorists' Symposium / deadline 27th January </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-MIGRATION-DIASPORA-GROUP;8175ec78.1501</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>This is just a kind reminder that the deadline for abstracts submission to<br>the BSA Early Career Theorists' Symposium is approaching: 27th January.<br><br>Please also note: We are trying to encourage people who may not necessarily<br>see themselves as pure theorists, to think about the role of theory in<br>their empirical research and vice-versa. This will certainly make the<br>symposium more interesting and productive. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-24T14:52:13+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>S. Please circulate.<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Ipek<br><br>=========<br><br>There are several scholarship opportunities in Turkey, especially for the Syrian refugees.<br><br>--Turkey hands around 4.000 undergraduate and graduate scholarships to foreign students all around the world under the brand name of &quot;T\ufffd\ufffdrkiye Scholarships.&quot; Students are allowed to chose among 200 different academic majors from 100 universities. Look out for application deadlines. As far as I know applications for graduate studies are in March and for undergraduate is on April.
